column4: theoretically, that's a deb:  what you're running into is like a windows program that needs a vb runtime installed as well
no internet access on that machine you said?
sorry if you've already answered this, are you running edgy or fiesty?
not on that machine, but I've been carting files over on a flash drive..
what packages have you been installing?
come on, get your priorities straight :)
do you have another ubuntu machine on the internet?
I believe you just need gstreamer0.10-ffmpeg
- i thought about using easy ubuntu to download them via the live cd, and then transfer them over, but i wasn't sure exactly what i was lookig for..
that's the one that provides mp3 and a bunch of other stuff, I don't think it depends on anything else
it _might_ be a slightly different version in edgy though
better off using ubuntu's, there's no guarentee of binary compatibiltiy between ubuntu and debian (even though it usually works)
plus there may be a bunch of different dependencies with debian
yep;  they often will, but ubuntu has different dependencies, so anything system'ish will often require a bunch of different stuff
yep, everything that gets installed is cached in /var/cache/apt, can probably just copy the whole mess
did you have any luck with the one gstreamer package I mentioned?  I'm almost certain it should Just Work.
